titles.title: Schoolhouse Religious Freedom Act
To protect the free exercise of religion by prohibiting religious coercion in our schools.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/13/1995--Introduced. Schoolhouse Religious Freedom Act - Prohibits the United States and individual States from coercing a student or employee in any public elementary or secondary school to pray or refrain from praying.
